name: Rodeway Inn & Suites Downtowner-Rte 66

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I knew what I was expecting when I reserved a room from Rodeway after reading the reviews from others, and, yes, it is all true. I checked in an hour after closing time and the staff was sweet enough to wait around for me. The girl running the hotel said that she had a couple checking in at 4 a.m. and was waiting for them also. The room was yes, very narrow, but extremely clean. I am very picky about cleanliness and I was surprised when the maids cleaned the room with disinfectant every single day. It smelled like Lysol when you walked in. It was within walking distance to the train that leads to the Grand Canyon and downtown. The breakfast wasn't anything special and we really did not use it, but for $70/day, there is not a better deal around! I LOVED the town of Williams, everybody was very friendly and very quiet. I do recommend taking a trip to Sonoma while there and do the Pink Jeep tours (very fun and beautiful!). Trip Advisor has turned out to be a great traveling companion as the reviews tend to be very accurate. Anyways, the place does not look like much from the outside, but it is the best place I ever stayed at!
reviews.title: Cleanest room I have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you only need a place to rest your head and have a hot shower.. oh wait.. I remember now.. our shower didn't have hot water..hha..I now remember using cups/glasses of hot water from the sink to take a hot shower... but it could have been our room. Having said that, We were still happy with the room because it was on Route 66 and nearby (straight shot) to our destination--Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was across the street and internet was out so they let people use one computer by the front desk.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

likes.liked: — They'd made a real effort with the styling of the rooms
likes.disliked: — I think Williams isn't the best base for the Canyon, but that's not the hotel's fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Cont. breakfast outside on patio... typical cont. breakfast
reviews.title: Nice! Don't judge the book by the cover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: Room: Very clean, updated (except hot water issues in our shower)
reviews.title: Great rooms, though cold at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We were very impressed with our stay at this Rodeway Inn as it is totally renovated in W Hotel style -- dark furnishings, flat screen tvs, leather chairs. We ended up here after our disaster at the Canyon Motel & RV Park in Williams (which we would not want to wish on our best friend -- stay there and you will be guaranteed no sleep as there are paper thin walls and two of the rooms have no heat, only a space heater!). Be forewarned -- there are 2 Rodeways in town and this is the good one. The other one is a dump.
reviews.title: Almost Like Having the W Hotel in Williams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The same owners own The Lodge hotel across the street which they also renovated with all new interior decorations. I took a look at one of the rooms and it was very impressive -- they must have hired a stellar designer as these are no ordinary hotel rooms. The lodge rooms look like a hunting lodge with all new beds, furnishings.
reviews.title: What a nice suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The continental breakfast is a little skimpy with twinkie like pastries, juice and coffee. But after a great night's sleep, a little Direct TV off the flat screen and a quick check of the internet, you really could care less.....plus the Grand Canyon is 1 hour away, door to door (The Canyon Motel told us 45 minutes which is impossible unless they have a Porsche and drive 90 MPH +)
reviews.title: AWSOME Hotel - Don't pass this one up from looking at it from the outside!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not hesitate to book here at the Rodeway, Downtowner or the The Lodge in Williams, AZ!
reviews.title: nothing special but a good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights while visiting the Grand Canyon. From the outside the hotel doesn't look like much but the rooms are newly remodeled, very clean and contemporary. I was very impressed, big comfortable bed, tile floors in entry and bath room. We stayed in room 104, see pictures posted. The wireless internet can be a little slow at times and also the room did not have a phone which wasn't that big of a deal to me. I met 2 different people that worked the front desk, both were very nice and helpful on recommending places to eat and shop. If ever in this area again I will be staying here.
reviews.title: A nice hotel, close to Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would have to be the most comfortable bed I have slept in for a long time (including my own!). This is a very appealing looking motel from the outside with a great neon to lure you in. It looks more appealing than many of its 1950s counterparts in the town because it's obviously had some money spent on it recently. The owner was super friendly. The room was very luxurious and comfortable for a motel and very cosy. Personally, I would have decorated the rooms in a more retro/mid century style to suit the motel's heritage, but its very comfortable and easy on the eye. The breakfast in the morning was fine with plenty of fresh coffee, pastries, yoghurt, fresh fruit etc and lots of comfortable seating in the courtyard or in the sunshine. Great overnight stay on way to or from Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: A little bit of luxury on Route 66

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a night before heading up to Grand Canyon, and we were very pleased with our choice. We were inexplicably upgraded to a junior suite, so we had extra space and the bathroom was separated from the sleeping room by french doors. The decor was very fresh and contemporary (rich but neutral colors, granite countertops and slate tile in the bath), the bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and separate roomy shower. Looking out the window we could see the train tracks, so I worried about train noise, but it was never an issue. The staff was friendly and gave us a good recommendation for dinner (Red Raven). Breakfast was just continental, but with oatmeal packets and yogurt to supplement the standard toast/bagels and packaged danish, we were able to make a breakfast that started us out adequately.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise in quaint Route 66 town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Based upon reviews from this site, we booked in for one night before heading for the Grand Canyon. While the room was a bit on the small size especially with a king sized bed, it was obviously redone not long ago. The bed was excellent, the rooms were quiet and very clean. Very small bathroom that one doesn't want to turn around in very quickly. Management was friendly and accommodating. The local in the center of town was handy for walking to shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: King bed in a small room- cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good value and a nice place to stay!
reviews.title: The BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights primarily to take railway to the Grand Canyon. Suite was small particularly with two teenage boys, two chairs in little seating area. That said fridge and microwave were handy.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was served outdoors across the road at the sister property, where you also check in. Internet access was fine and felt safe at all time.
reviews.title: Much nicer than some reviews state

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If returning to Williams would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location on the way to Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel one night and were so pleased. We were taking the train to the Grand Canyon the next day. Our room was just great. Very comfortable beds! We would stay here again. A little pricey, but worth it.
reviews.title: A very nice motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location on the way to Grand Canyon. Quick check in/out. Nice design, but it was very hot in the room and a/c was situated in bit inconvenient place. Poor breakfrast. Free parking. GREAT STEAKS in the restaurant - few steps from the hotel.
reviews.title: "What a super surprise."

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Williams, AZ. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel's proximity to Grand Canyon makes it a great choice for those going to visit it as well.
reviews.title: Great Choice For Anyone Going to Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of our favorite places we stayed on our month long road trip across the U.S. We stayed in all 3 star hotels, but couldn't find a place to stay around the Grand Canyon. I called The Lodge on Route 66 because of the trip advisor reviews and asked if they had a room for around $100/night. They guy was really helpful and said we could stay at their property across the street, the Downtowner, for $100. The Room was awesome. Really classy and Clean. There were people out in the common area in the middle of the parking lot late at night and in the morning having a good time. They weren't loud at all. Just having a good time. The lady at the desk was super nice and happy where she worked. It had a great community feel. Definitely hope to stay here again.
reviews.title: Awesome Motel
Very clean, upgraded hotel with a lot of character
reviews.text: I had read great reviews about this hotel and had planned to stay there after our visit to the Grand Canyon. When we first pulled up to the hotel at night, we were a little skeptical. We noticed a lady placing pillows on the benchs and decided to take a look at one of the rooms. It was beautifully decorated, clean and newly renovated. We checked in across the street and had a great time talking to the person at the front desk. The room was very comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. We plan to book this hotel again for a vacation that will be for more than just one night. Just really hard to find a great hotel like this one.

reviews.title: Clean and wonderful
reviews.text: I never write reviews but feel that this motel deserves one. It was clean, clean, clean. The rooms are small but so clean. The staff is warm, friendly and very helpful. There is a train that runs near the hotel but it is part of the charm of the town. Hint turn on the AC fan in the room and you won't hear anything from outside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast offered is nice juice, coffee, fruit, and an assortment of breads it was a nice way to start the day. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: We won't forget our stay on Route 66

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: For a roadside motel this is really fantastic. We stayed just one night and regretted not having spent more time here, both in the hotel and in Williams.
reviews.title: Great rooms and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were welcomed by the friendliest of ladies, who explained how everything worked and even offered to book us a table in the restaurant we had spotted in our guidebook. What a lovely touch!
reviews.title: An excellent place to stay I just wish we were here longer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: The room certainly wasn't your average motel type. It has obviously been refurbished recently , to a kind of chic contemporary feel that puts many upmarket city hotels to shame. The bathroom was also brand new, with plenty of fresh fluffy towels for our family of 4. Most importantly, the whole place was spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Never judge a hotel by it's exterior!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: We had no noise problems from the road through town, as the traffic seems to die out past 11p.m and thus we had a very good night's sleep right up until a train came tooting through at 5:30 a.m. But hey, that's all part of the atmosphere for tourists like ourselves!
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel located perfectly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was included and served in a covered patio, again a nice touch in the summer months.
reviews.title: Highway Robbers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rolled into town after a visit to the Grand Canyon. Looked a little tough, if you are used to the Embassy Suites, but the rooms were clean and neat. I cannot say how rooms looked at other motels, but I have been to some real dives, and this place is a place I could take the family to over and over again. With no hesitation.
reviews.title: SWEET

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Rooms updated. CLEAN. Would be proud to take my mother to. And my family was surprised by the level of cleanliness of this place. It really was THAT decent. Cheers to the fellow from the Netherlands and the biker couple. You are the BEST! (Visit with your neighbors after 11 pm outside your room. Worth it!)
reviews.title: Just right for the Grand Canyon Railway stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is just across the street from the depot. you can even buy your train tickets from themotel. This is a small one story facility reminiscent of the past. However the rooms have been nicely updated in a more stylish manner than they may have been previously. Furnishings are contemporary, but dark woods give a just right western feel.
reviews.title: The suites are lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Included breakfast has the usual pastries, toast options, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, and tea. Happily, the packaged pastry selection is more varied than usual, and the danishes were of a markedly better quality than this level motel usually serves.
reviews.title: Very nice older motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Most unusually, breakfast is served on an open air covered patio with abundant fresh air, cool even on an August morning. The patio is a nice spot to relax in the evening, too.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Rodeway Inn. We were very pleased with our stay as our room was spotless, the staff was friendly and everything was completely renovated. Although the room was a bit smaller than we anticipated, it was perfect enough for our stay (bed was very comfortable). We will absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This place has been totally renovated and you can tell the owner has put a lot of time, money and imagination into this endeavor. The rooms are beautiful w/super comfy beds and our room had a separate sitting/tv area w/a very oversized bathroom. It was just a few steps from downtown Williams which is a great little town. Lots of stuff to see and good restaurants. Rob, the owner of this property was absolutely great and very accommodating. We recommend this place highly to anyone visiting Williams Arizona. The only drawback I could determine was the train whistle that went off a couple times duirng the night. But then I am a light sleeper. Awesome place!!
reviews.title: A Must Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a revamped motel on Route 66 and they've done a great job. We were across the street from the lobby. Our room was quite small but spotless and the 4-poster king bed was great. The sink area and bathroom were all new and very nice. It was perfect for 2 people as a stopover on the way to the Canyon. We enjoyed walking around Williams the next morning. It's a quaint, quirky place with very friendly people.
reviews.title: Good overnight stop near Grand Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Rodeway Downtowner Route 66 during our visit to the Grand Canyon. We chose to stay in Williams, AZ to avoid the large crowds of tourists in the Flagstaff area. We took wonderful photos of our suite, but they still do not do the rooms justice! It looks like a "modern" renovated 50's motel on the outside, but you will be pleasantly surprised when you see the interior. The one-person jacuzzi tub was heaven after spending an entire day boucing around in a Jeep traveling to the bottom of the Grand Canyon and back. Our check-in was speedy and easy, and the personnal were very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: A preserved piece of Americana with beautiful modern upgrades matching any upscale hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Others have commented on the highway and train noise. Our room was on the north side of the hotel directly across the highway from the train. We ALWAYS travel will a buzz fan, so we never hear a thing.
reviews.title: Great Stay for the price

description: Totally renovated. Flat screen TV's. Luxury linens. Located in the heart of Williams, great location!
